intro: Hiraea oxyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hiraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
